note:
Hi, I'm Aaron Parecki,  co-founder of
IndieWebCamp.
I maintain oauth.net, write and consult about OAuth, and
am the editor of several W3C specifications. I help people learn about video production and livestreaming and dabble in product design.

I've been tracking my location since 2008 and I wrote 100 songs in 100 days.
I've spoken at conferences around the world about
owning your data,
OAuth,
quantified self,
and explained why R is a vowel. Read more.
name: Aaron Parecki

content.html: I cancelled my Adobe CC subscription and got back $55/mo and 55gb of hard drive space

content.html: I've been carrying this co2 sensor with me the last few days and it's really interesting to see how different various environments like outside/cars/plane are. It also has a barometric pressure sensor. Guess when the flight was.
content.value: I've been carrying this co2 sensor with me the last few days and it's really interesting to see how different various environments like outside/cars/plane are. It also has a barometric pressure sensor. Guess when the flight was.

content.html: Turns out when you put 5 people from 3 continents in front of a pool table there are 125 different ways to play pool

content.html:
Just landed in Seattle and realized even tho I fly thru here all the time I barely actually ever leave the airport!

Super excited to be helping out with this event tomorrow tho! There's still space if you want to join!

https://twitter.com/auth0/status/1560628964254679040

content.html: Why is it that every time I click a link on my phone it opens a native app that fails to load the content I clicked on, but then when I am on a website and actually *want* the native app to open there's no way to make it actually do that
content.value: Why is it that every time I click a link on my phone it opens a native app that fails to load the content I clicked on, but then when I am on a website and actually *want* the native app to open there's no way to make it actually do that

content.html: I enjoy editing still photos in Lightroom and tweaking colors and contrast and such, but I need to figure out how to translate that to enjoying color grading video, because right now it's my least favorite part of the process and instead I use the footage straight out of camera

content.html: In case you needed a reminder about why we care so much about OAuth/OIDC flows being used in the system browser and not embedded browsers, Instagram injects their own tracking code in every web page you visit inside Instagram https://krausefx.com/blog/ios-privacy-instagram-and-facebook-can-track-anything-you-do-on-any-website-in-their-in-app-browser
content.value: In case you needed a reminder about why we care so much about OAuth/OIDC flows being used in the system browser and not embedded browsers, Instagram injects their own tracking code in every web page you visit inside Instagram https://krausefx.com/blog/ios-privacy-instagram-and-facebook-can-track-anything-you-do-on-any-website-in-their-in-app-browser
